result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon E. Rockweiler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon E. Rockweiler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon E. Rockweiler was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Brandon E. Rockweiler was found guilty of Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CONSECUTIVE to Ct. 1.
**AS OF COURT HEARING ON 4/7/17 DEFT'S MOTION TO TERMINATE PROBATION IS GRANTED.  SENTENCE OF 5/11/15 IS VACATED.  CASE TO BE RESENTENCED ON 5/15/17 @ 3:30 PM.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
*  Pay resitution plus surcharges. To be determined.  
Not to unlawfully operate a motor vehicle.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new or criminal charge made against the deft.

DOC-37  Zero Restitution (no response from victim)  kmk

1. DE may be temporarily released from KCDC  to assist with emergency medical arrangements relating to his father.
2. DE shall make up the time that he is furloughed so that he will serve the full sentence that is imposed in this case.
3. DE shall not drive a motor vehicle during his absence from the jail.
4. DE shall not commit any crimes during this period.
5. Upon return to KCDC, DE shall submit to any chemical tests of breath, blood, or urine as required.
6. Failure to return to jail may result in a separate felony prosecution.
7. Failure to abide by any portion of this order may result in additional punishment.

Defendant, Brandon E. Rockweiler, appeared with Attorney Jeremy Chavez.  Attorney K. Richard Wells appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: DE's request for furlough; discussion held. Atty Henry requests electronic monitoring; denied. The Court does not oppose the KSD issuing a furlough for the DE to visit his father and the DE may make up the time at the end of his sentence. Atty Henry to prepare the order.
for Furlogh of Jail Sentence.
Motion Hearing set for 06-30-15 at 1:15 pm at the request of Atty Chavez for DE to make a furlough request.

Clerk RMM received phone call from Atty Aileen Henry requesting contact with Judge to request a furlough for defendant who's father was involved in a motorcycle in Neenah. Atty Henry indicates she has all relevant hospital information. Judge Schroeder will grant the furlough at the discretion of the sentence. The defendant must make up for any time released and that time should be included as part of any time served. Email to Capt Levin at KSD with this information. /rmm

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 2; found guilty by the Court.  Counts 3 & 4 are dismissed on State's motion.  Counts 5 & 6 are dismissed and read-in on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 4/20/15 @ 2pm.
